content.description:
Sir Silicon of Sota is technical piece that requires more balance than power.

Sit start with hands matched on the shelf. From there, traverse right along the shelf to the arete. At the arete, throw a left heel up, reach a left hand crimp on the arete's east face, mantle with the right, and work the remaining arete, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two should be good. The landing is clear but gently sloping.
content.location: It climbs the south face shelf to the southeast arete.

content.description: Squat start with a left hand bump and a right hand jug. From there, pull to a right hand crimp, gain a foot on the start hold, work the left hand gaston, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work, the landing is clear but slopes away beneath the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Laramidia's south face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on an edge about seven feet off the deck. From there, work the feet up thin edges/pockets, stick the lip, traverse along the lip to the right, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should do it. The landing is clear but gently sloping.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Laramidia's south face.
